content: Beta-blockers and non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers. Concomitant use with amiodarone may cause sinus bradycardia or AV block. The presence of bradycardia is notably linked to the use of amiodarone and any medication aimed at controlling heart rate. Among individuals on amiodarone, bradycardia is most strongly correlated with the use of rate-controlling medications and being female [ 37 ]. Consequently, caution is advised when prescribing dual therapy with amiodarone and beta-blockers or amiodarone and non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers .
query: beta-blockers safety profile atrial fibrillation heart failure contraindications bradycardia hypotension
title: Amiodarone Therapy: Updated Practical Insights
authors: Sorodoc, V., Indrei, L., Dobroghii, C., Asaftei, A., Ceasovschih, A., Constantin, M., Lionte, C., Morărasu, B. C., Diaconu, A.-D., Sorodoc, L.
reference: Sorodoc, V., Indrei, L., Dobroghii, C., Asaftei, A., Ceasovschih, A., Constantin, M., Lionte, C., Morărasu, B. C., Diaconu, A.-D., & Sorodoc, L. (2024). Amiodarone therapy: Updated practical insights. Journal of Clinical Medicine, 13(20), 6094. https://doi.org/10.3390/jcm13206094
